result.execSummary:
The defendant Nyree N Holt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: with 4 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Forfeiture as assessed in 15TR4633.
Restitution in the amount of $0.
Pay all court costs.
Pay DNA surcharges.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Cash Bail to apply
- If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary. Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: The first 3 months straight time with no good time and the second 3 months with Huber for work only.  Defendant to report on 1/4/2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nyree N Holt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Case passed for court to here another case.  Case recalled with same appearances with Thomas Potter for Franco Mineo for the State.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4.5 YEARS with 4 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program
Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 years Probation

  Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 6 months in the HOC; the first 3 months straight time with no good time and the second 3 months with Huber for work only.  Defendant to report on 1/4/2016
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 50 hours of community service
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Forfeiture as assessed in 15TR4633
Restitution in the amount of $0
Pay all court costs
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant thatshe may not vote until her civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Sentence Referral Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Due to calendar congestion   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the information as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense request an adjournment.  Defendant needs to have her hearing aid issue resolved to properly proceed on the case..  Br. 19 is in jury trial on another case.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report.

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Conen.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Cimpl, Br. 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Positive drug screen for THC.)

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea Hearing date.
 Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-26-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County Deputy Elston Howze.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM020205  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/17/2015
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Nyree N Holt in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Nyree N Holt in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Court orders DNA sample to be collected.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
